stimulusHtml: Which type of electromagnetic radiation, visible light (λ≈10−6 m) or microwaves (λ≈10−2 m), exhibits more diffraction when interacting with everyday objects, and why?
choicesHtml: Visible light, because there is more visible light emitted from everyday objects than there are microwaves.
Visible light, because its waves have a higher energy than microwaves do.
Microwaves, because they are easier to produce than visible light waves, since visible light preferentially behaves like photons.
Microwaves, because their wavelength is longer than that of visible light.
